intro: Lepidoceras, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Lepidoceras plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
